item.title: Fibonacci numbers and determinant
item.description: Fibonacci sequence is a sequence as \[1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13, 21, 35…\] it satisfies: \(F_n = F_{n - 1} + F_{n - 2}(n \ge 3), F_1 = 1, F_2 = 2\) Proof the Fibonacci numbers \(F_n\) can be get from the determinant \[ F_n = {\begin{vmatrix} 1 & -1 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0 & 0 & 0\\ 1 & 1 & -1 & 0 & \cdots & 0 & 0 & 0\\ 0 & 1 & 1 & -1 & \cdots & 0 & 0 & 0\\ \vdots & \vdots & \vdots & \vdots & & \vdots & \vdots & \vdots\\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 1 & 1 & -1\\ 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \cdots & 0 & 1 & 1\\ \end{vmatrix} }; \]
